item.description:
It seems to me, that last week, the trails might have gotten the better of me, of us... thou we did put up a good fight... I think.

Like a schoolyard bully, Arcadia left me, left us bent over gasping for air, skinned-kneed and without our milk money. But like all of us who have been pushed in the hallway or tripped in the cafeteria, I swore the sacred anthem of the proverbially Picked-on: “Just wait until next time!!! You’ll see…”

Well… IT’S NEXT TIME!! And Arcadia had better watch out!!

 

As you can see, I’ve received a little help over the past week. And this Wednesday, I plan on returning to the playground to take on Arcadia, pledging not to give up until I, until we have given Arcadia little choice but to call out, "UNCLE!!"

The Ride:
This time we'll start a little further into the woods, meeting at the Frosty Hollow Pond parking area (a 3/4 mile drive up the dirt road from the intersection of Rt 165 & Frosty Hollow Rd). Again, we’ll assemble our rides, but instead of heading north, we'll head west, riding some sweet single-track before we hit our first fire road.

The plan is to ride rings around Arcadia, keeping us out in the woods for up to two hours. Single track is our goal, but fire roads will be graciously accepted. And should our legs give out, or darkness settle in, we’ll take advantage of the trails or fire roads that will return us to our cars in the shortest amount of time and/or the least amount of effort.

On trail you can expect to experience a combination of fire roads and single-track, passing through forests and fields, over varied terrain, from smooth to rough, over rocks and roots, gravel and dirt which will require a bit of technical skill. But no worries, because we will be following the Primary Rules of Mountain Biking: 1. We ride as a group; 2. We hike what we cannot ride; and 3. We wait at all major trailheads. Our pace will be moderate and accommodating (no speedsters here), but, you should know that the ride is filled with a number of short steep ups and downs, and I ask that you believe yourself to be an intermediately skilled rider, or a fit beginner/intermediate rider willing to be challenged by the terrain. I will be riding a rigid single-speed (no shocks) w/ flat pedals, so my pace will not be blazing, nor will I be riding up every climb; that my friends is for another time.

 

Directions:
From the intersection of Rt 3 and Rt 165, follow Rt 165 east for approximately 2.75 miles. Turn right into Frosty Hollow Rd (dirt road @ the white church) and continue for .75 miles, turning right into a small parking area just after the small fishing pond.

Google Maps: http://maps.google.com/maps?

Coordinates: 41.587755, -71.709374

Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Frosty Hollow Pond parking area (3/4 of a mile North of Rt 165 & the white church); call if you can't find us. Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Bike Arcadia: Again
